name: Low Watermilfoil

Identifying Characteristics: Leaves: brownish red, finely feather divided, 5-12 leaflet pairs, radially scattered, internodal space <5mm
Flowers: midsummer, tiny, produced in leaf axils
Fruits/Seeds: nutlet with four smooth sided sections
Habitat: Prefer quiet waters of lakes and streams
Look Alikes: Other Leafy Watermilfoils, especially Farwell's Watermilfoil
Range: Native Range: Maine, New England, northern portion of eastern United States

tags: plants with finely-divided leaves on stems
